fundamentalTruths.truth: Restaurants operate in real-time with zero tolerance for delays
fundamentalTruths.implication: Every system interaction must be <200ms, real-time sync is mandatory
fundamentalTruths.current_gap: Most POS systems have 1-3 second delays for order updates

fundamentalTruths.truth: Restaurant staff work with their hands, not keyboards
fundamentalTruths.implication: Interface must be touch-first, voice-enabled, with minimal text input
fundamentalTruths.current_gap: Traditional POS requires extensive typing and complex navigation

fundamentalTruths.truth: Peak hours create 10x normal load with no room for system failures
fundamentalTruths.implication: Architecture must handle extreme load spikes gracefully
fundamentalTruths.current_gap: Most systems slow down or crash during peak hours

fundamentalTruths.truth: Restaurant margins are razor-thin (3-5% profit margins)
fundamentalTruths.implication: Every feature must directly impact revenue or reduce costs
fundamentalTruths.current_gap: POS systems add cost without clear ROI measurement

fundamentalTruths.truth: Customers expect instant gratification and seamless experiences
fundamentalTruths.implication: Customer-facing interfaces must be faster than consumer apps
fundamentalTruths.current_gap: Restaurant tech feels slow compared to consumer mobile apps

fundamentalTruths.truth: Restaurant operations are physical and location-specific
fundamentalTruths.implication: System must understand physical context (table, kitchen, bar)
fundamentalTruths.current_gap: Most systems treat all locations and contexts identically

fundamentalTruths.truth: Staff turnover is extremely high (70%+ annually)
fundamentalTruths.implication: Interface must be intuitive enough for new staff to use immediately
fundamentalTruths.current_gap: Complex POS systems require extensive training

architecturalDecisions.reasoning: Restaurant operations are event-driven (order placed, food ready, payment processed)
Staff hands are busy, voice is natural and fast
Different roles need different interfaces (kitchen vs front-of-house)

implementation.pattern: Progressive Web App with Context Switching

architecturalDecisions.reasoning: Different teams can work on Kitchen, Customer, Admin interfaces independently
Traditional payment processing is expensive and slow
Restaurants can benefit from predictive analytics for inventory, staffing, demand

deliverables: Real-time order sync across all devices
Voice command system for basic operations
Adaptive UI that changes based on role/context

competitiveAdvantages.orderfi_target: OrderFi: 3-6 seconds per order via voice commands

competitiveAdvantages.advantage: Zero Training Time for New Staff

competitiveAdvantages.revenue_impact: Faster response to trends, optimized operations

uxImprovements.current_problem: Complex multi-screen navigation with small buttons
uxImprovements.first_principles_solution: Single-screen voice-first interface with large visual confirmation
uxImprovements.implementation: Voice command + large card-based visual confirmation system
uxImprovements.mockup_description: One main screen with customer order displayed as large cards, voice input at bottom, visual feedback for all actions

uxImprovements.current_problem: Static text-based order lists that don't prioritize effectively
uxImprovements.first_principles_solution: Dynamic priority-based visual system with time-sensitive alerts
uxImprovements.implementation: Color-coded priority system, expanding cards for urgent orders, drag-and-drop workflow management
uxImprovements.mockup_description: Kanban-style board with order cards that change color/size based on urgency, drag to move between prep/cooking/ready

uxImprovements.current_problem: Multiple steps for payment with complex fee structures
uxImprovements.first_principles_solution: One-tap payment with transparent, minimal fees
uxImprovements.implementation: QR code USDC payment, automatic tip calculation, instant settlement confirmation
uxImprovements.mockup_description: Single QR code with payment amount, customer scans, instant confirmation with receipt

uxImprovements.current_problem: Manual counting and complex forms for inventory updates
uxImprovements.first_principles_solution: AI-powered automatic inventory tracking with voice confirmations
uxImprovements.implementation: Camera-based inventory scanning, voice-confirmed stock updates, predictive reorder suggestions
uxImprovements.mockup_description: Camera viewfinder for scanning items, voice confirmation for quantities, automated reorder recommendations

uxImprovements.first_principles_solution: Visual drag-and-drop scheduling with role-based automatic permissions
uxImprovements.implementation: Calendar-based visual scheduling, automatic permission assignment, real-time availability tracking
uxImprovements.mockup_description: Visual calendar with staff photos, drag-and-drop scheduling, color-coded role indicators
